channel.title: Reactjs Clojure Core.async Sse on (Insightful) Ramblings
channel.description: Recent content in Reactjs Clojure Core.async Sse on (Insightful) Ramblings

item.title: Experiments part 8
item.description: Previously in Experiments, part 7,… I switched from Compojure to Pedestal in order to take advantage of its support for Server-sent Events. I want to use that to send background updates to the client on completion of a task. This took a while I expected this feature to be done very quickly. Up to now, every library I had to integrate into my app did so nearly seamlessly. It was a matter of reading the appropriate section of the library’s documentation, doing a few REPL experiments, integrating the code and doing manual testing.
